explanation: The report is correct. The parameter argv is declared as char *const *const argv, so argv[i] has type char * (pointer to mutable characters), but the function never modifies the characters. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types when possible, so the pointed-to characters should be const-qualified. The appropriate signature is, for example, const char *const *const argv (and the corresponding main prototype should be adjusted similarly). Note: when changing the prototype you must update all callers (e.g. main) to use the matching const-qualified type; this is necessary because pointer-to-pointer qualification changes are not implicitly compatible in C.
